alert.note: Alert for Knox; Marion; Morrow; Richland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 07 at 5:53AM EST until March 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following counties, Knox, Marion, Morrow and Richland. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion, Mount Vernon, Mount Gilead, Fredericktown, Gambier, Cardington, Centerburg, Prospect, Danville, La Rue, Morral, Waldo, Chesterville, Sparta, Waterford, Caledonia, New Bloomington, Edison, Green Camp and Marengo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
